algorithm_technique: Dynamic programming with modulo arithmetic to track people sharing the secret.
problem_summary_simple: Calculate how many people know a secret on day n, considering sharing delays and forgetting.
problem_summary_technical: DP state represents people who will forget the secret within 'forget' days. Transitions use modulo arithmetic for large numbers.
key_insights: The problem can be modeled as a DP where dp[i] represents the number of people who will forget the secret on day i.
Modulo arithmetic is crucial to handle large numbers.
The DP state can be optimized to use a fixed-size array (size 'forget') by using the modulo operator on indices.
